variants.Description in input context: A53T missense mutation in α - synuclein
A30P missense mutation in α - synuclein
E46K missense mutation in α - synuclein

Material used.Description: Cells were incubated with serum - free DMEM for 1 h to deplete cells of transferrin followed by washes and then incubated in buffer with 55FeCl3 for iron uptake assessment.

Readout description.Conclusion: DMT1 overexpression led to a 300 - fold increase in iron uptake compared with control SH - SY5Y cells; treatment with iron resulted in greater cell death in S - DMT1 stable cell lines compared with S - V vector cell line after 24 h especially for 10 and 15 mM FeCl2
Readout description.Result Description: S - DMT1 cells stably expressing DMT1 mediated a dramatic 300 - fold increase in iron uptake compared with control SH - SY5Y cells. Treatment with iron resulted in greater cell death in the S - DMT1 stable cell lines compared with the S - V vector cell line after 24 h especially for 10 and 15 mM FeCl2

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way analysis of variance was used to compare the values between two or more groups supported by multiple comparisons. This was followed by the Bonferroni's post hoc test. The level of statistical significance was set at p < 0.05 (*).

Material used.Material Name: SH - SY5Y double stable cell lines
Material used.Description: Cells were seeded at a concentration of 80,000 cells/well into 48 - well plates and grown to 80% confluence. Treated with FeCl2 and then incubated with calcein - AM dye for iron uptake determination.

Readout description.Conclusion: Upon treatment with iron, there was no difference in iron uptake among the α - synuclein - expressing double stable cell lines when compared with the control SD - V cell line
Readout description.Result Description: The uptake of iron in the double stable cell lines was determined using a cell - permeable calcein - AM dye. There was no difference in iron uptake among the α - synuclein - expressing double stable cell lines when compared with the control SD - V cell line

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way analysis of variance was used to compare the values between two or more groups supported by multiple comparisons. This was followed by the Bonferroni's post hoc test. The level of statistical significance was set at p < 0.05 (*).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Iron Treatments and Trypan Blue Exclusion Analysis

Material used.Description: Cells were cultured with daily changes of DMEM containing 100 μM FeCl2 for up to 6 days for a chronic cellular model of PD.

Readout description.Conclusion: The SD - A53T double stable cell line displayed synergistic toxicity when treated with iron over several days; there was an approximately 2 - fold decrease in SD - A53T cell viability with Fe2 + treatment compared with SD - V especially from day 4 onward
Readout description.Result Description: For a chronic cellular model of PD, cells were exposed to elevated iron for up to 6 days. The SD - A53T double stable cell line showed a decrease in viability compared to SD - V from day 4 onward when treated with 100 μM FeCl2

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way analysis of variance was used to compare the values between two or more groups supported by multiple comparisons. This was followed by the Bonferroni's post hoc test. The level of statistical significance was set at p < 0.05 (*).

Material used.Description: Approximately 50 μg of total protein from harvested cells were resolved on 10 - 15% SDS - PAGE gels before transfer onto nitrocellulose membrane and detection using ECL reagents with various antibodies.

Readout description.Conclusion: After 4 days of treatment with 100 μM FeCl2, the level of oxidized proteins was about 4 times higher for SD - A53T compared with SD - WT and SD - A30P cell lines; no cytochrome c was observed in the cytosolic fraction of SD - A53T cells after 4 days of iron treatment; cleaved caspase 3 was not observed in iron - treated SD - A53T cells; increased conversion of LC3 - I to - II was observed in SD - A53T cells after 4 days of iron treatment
Readout description.Result Description: Used to detect levels of various proteins such as α - synuclein, Akt, JNK, phospho - JNK, cathepsin D, SOD2, DMT1, β - actin, caspases 3 and 9, cytochrome c, apoptosis - inducing factor, LC3B. Oxidized proteins were higher in SD - A53T, no cytochrome c release, no cleaved caspase 3, and increased LC3 - I to - II conversion in SD - A53T

Material used.Description: About 15 μg of harvested cell lysates from day 4 of Fe2 + treatment were incubated with the succinyl - LLVY - AMC substrate for 2 h at 37 °C.

Readout description.Conclusion: No changes in ubiquitin - proteasome system activity between iron - treated and untreated cells on the 4th day
Readout description.Result Description: Used to determine proteasomal activity. There was no difference in ubiquitin - proteasome system activity between iron - treated and untreated cells on the 4th day

Material used.Description: Cell lysates were prepared after 4 days of Fe2 + treatment and then used for the OxyBlot Protein Oxidation Detection kit protocol.

Readout description.Conclusion: After 4 days of treatment with 100 μM FeCl2, the level of oxidized proteins (protein carbonyls) was about 4 times higher for SD - A53T compared with SD - WT and SD - A30P cell lines
Readout description.Result Description: Cellular oxidative stress levels were determined using the OxyBlot Protein Oxidation Detection kit. Oxidized proteins were higher in SD - A53T after 4 days of 100 μM FeCl2 treatment
